alert.note: Alert for Breckinridge; Grayson; Hancock; Hardin; Ohio (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hancock, northwestern Grayson, west central Hardin, southern Breckinridge and northeastern Ohio Counties through 715 PM EDT/615 PM CDT/... At 642 PM EDT/542 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southeast of Whitesville, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Grayson, southeastern Hancock, west central Hardin, northeastern Ohio and southern Breckinridge Counties, including the following locations... Mcquady, Dyer, Se Ree, Shreve, Buras, Solway, Tar Hill, Duff, Kirk and Vanzant. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT/800 PM CDT/ for central Kentucky.
